column1: It’s Trevor’s 13th Birthday 🎂. I am proud to be his dad. Pretty soon he’ll be able to beat his ol’ man in basketball 🏀....but not yet. #lovethatkid #timeflies https://t.co/JENKVVRHDQ

Here we go again: Trump plans to divert $7.2 billion in military construction funding to build a wall. When he did this last year an important project at Fort Huachua was eliminated. How can we know Arizona military bases won’t be hurt again? https://t.co/TfbSJ6VEdZ

Huge congrats to @SunDevilWBB and @ASUCoachCharli for an amazing achievement this weekend. In back to back games ASU defeated the #2 ranked team in the country on Friday  (@OregonWBB) and the #3 ranked team today (@BeaverWBB). https://t.co/ViMr9GDyDZ

The limitless strength and determination of my friend @GabbyGiffords inspires me every day to never back down from the fight to end gun violence. I know that her advocacy would make Christina-Taylor Dorothy Judge Roll Phyllis Dorwan and Gabe so proud. https://t.co/4UXcXJVMmz

Last night’s horrific domestic terrorism in Monsey NY should give pause to every American. Anti-Semitism is on the rise and we have to come together and take action to stop it. Everyone deserves to worship or celebrate without fear. https://t.co/nJ6lDErJNY

During @DrPanch's time at @ASU leading knowledge enterprise development he helped grow @asuresearch performance 5xs and solidified the University's ranking as the most innovative school in the U.S. He will do great work heading @NSF. Congratulations on the nomination Panch!
Congrats to my friend and impactful leader David Luna. @leagueofcities is fortunate to have @MesaDistrict5 leading this important committee. https://t.co/5cn7bOi8M2
@DoctorRhetorica @ymca @arizona_sos @Suns @trailblazers Bummed to miss it. I’ll be on a plane back to Washington. Thanks for all you do to support our kids and teachers.
Friday night basketball with my son....that’s my zen moment. https://t.co/DmpzjVntOq

It’s my tremendous honor having @RepLucyMcBath as my seat mate on the House Judiciary Committee. I admire her for her dignity faith and commitment to justice in all issues and challenges we confront. #publicservant @HouseJudiciary https://t.co/HyGsHgVv6a

@david_darmofal @RepValDemings @RepGregStanton Sending you love and prayers on the loss of your mom. Your story of your mom remembering me from Cortez High School warms my heart. My mom also had Alzheimer’s and entered heaven 7 years ago. I was thinking of her today.

This #GivingTuesday consider supporting a local org working to end homelessness both through direct services and advocating for just and humane policies. Here’s a few: @ANewLeafAZ @AZCendCommunity @UMOM @CircletheCityAZ @SVdP @CASS_AZ @TempeCommAction @SpeakUp4Homes @phxmission

Congratulations to @TucsonRomero and welcome to your first day as Tucson's mayor.  You will do a great job leading the city and will serve as inspiration and role model for young people pursuing public service leadership. I look forward to working closely with you.

Mayor you served your city effectively and honorably. The people of Tucson are in a stronger position because of your leadership. I’m proud to be your friend and colleague. #Godspeed https://t.co/wstkjTQjx6

On Mesa’s Main Street you can find Mezona Market the perfect boutique for spreading Arizona pride. Their collection of gifts are thoughtfully curated and celebrate our amazing AZ community. Beware of the @sweetcakescafe cookies though it’s impossible to eat just one. #shopsmall https://t.co/kV1UIRA6Zr

Mill Ave is a great place to find some local treasures. Refueled at Delicious Factory with the # 50 Tropical Smoothie (at the owner James’s recommendation) and found some vintage political buttons at Old Town Books. They’ve been collecting and selling for more than 35 years! https://t.co/1aP5pYk6CS

Here’s a twofer! Had to make a stop at @CactusSportsAZ for some extra swag for tonight’s Territorial Cup game—plus something spirited for Trevor to put under the tree. Alumni-owned Cactus Sports on Mill has been serving up your @ASU gear for more than 25 years! #shopsmall https://t.co/jVVMiBQwkP

Starting my #SmallBusinessSaturday with a cup of coffee at La Grande Orange in Arcadia. It’s the perfect place to pop in for a bite to eat and locally-curated gifts for the whole family. I found the perfect thing for Violet but I’ll keep it secret until Christmas. (Hint: 🦄) https://t.co/PpR9PGh7gy
Wishing you a #HappyThanksgiving. We are especially thankful for all the women and men of law enforcement (Armed Forces police fire emergency services) away from their families keeping us safe.
Congrats to @ArizonaCoyotes President @ahronCo21 on winning the prestigious #TorchofLiberty Award from @ADLArizona.  Your leadership in our community is appreciated.
Congrats to a great lawyer and community leader and now a hall of famer. @DanCBarr https://t.co/b5iP17NA3V
#BeerSummit https://t.co/qsNWvaj7Se

And @ReynaEMontoya is a perfect choice for the Young Professional #Athena. She is an amazing inspirational person whose passion for fighting for DREAMers is making a huge difference. https://t.co/ba9B4CvLfl

I’m ecstatic @phxchamber selected Cindy Dach for its prestigious private sector #Athena award. No one has worked more effectively to move the #dtphx/RoRo community in a positive direction. Smart creative thoughtful strategic classy ethical...she’s all of those and more. https://t.co/zRVvfpvk5w

No child should ever fear for their safety at school and yet we are raising a generation of students who know no other reality. Today’s tragedy in Santa Clarita should shock and anger all Americans. It’s way past time to pass common sense gun safety laws.
Your leadership inspires. #DREAMERS are woven into the social and economic fabric of Arizona. Your fight makes our state and country stronger. https://t.co/PwwEXB4n8u

Excited to support the re-election of one of my favorite people @JenLongdon.  She is an impactful state legislator and an important national voice for gun violence prevention. A huge turnout at her kickoff tonight. https://t.co/8vnXRgZWSl

The results from yesterday’s election in Maricopa County are a testament to our community’s values. Every bond (both school district and city) and override in #AZ09 passed—a win for our kids schools teachers education support staff seniors parks and public safety.
If you've already mailed or dropped off your ballot you can check the status of your ballot here: https://t.co/kzo4KN8BO2

If you haven't mailed your ballot you must drop it off in person TODAY at any poll location by 7 p.m. A list of all voting centers is available here: https://t.co/R2m22L70Co Remember you can drop your ballot off at any location—find one close to your home or office.

It's election day Maricopa County! Voters in dozens of school districts will decide the future of bonds and override funding requests—decisions that will be felt in our classrooms. Our schools and teachers do so much with so little we have to show up for them at the polls.

Yesterday was the Campaign Kickoff for 2 great people seeking re-election in #LD28 @KelliButlerAZ & @aaron4az. Our state is stronger with their common sense leadership in our state legislature. #take28 https://t.co/ZELWzOQ15i

Despite frigid temperatures sleet and wrong team winning I had fun in Salt Lake City watching @ASUFootball with Congressman (and former mayor) @BenMcAdams and @UUtah President @RuthVWatkins. https://t.co/6nddrVGHOb

Smart investment in public transportation is good for people good for business and good for sustainability. People living near light rail in my district save over $3200 per year on transportation costs. https://t.co/3z925Y2KUL

Happy Double Ten! Today Taiwan celebrates its National Day marking the establishment of the Republic of China. It’s a day when the Taiwanese community both home and abroad celebrates their country and culture.

My heart is with the Jewish community in Halle Germany which experienced a horrific attack on Yom Kippur Judaism’s holiest day. America must help lead the global fight against anti-Semitism and all forms of terrorism.

Today we celebrated. My team worked closely with pro bono attorneys at @GT_Law and we successfully obtained humanitarian parole for Makulang. He’s a South Sudanese young man whose strength and resilience will lead to a bright future in the USA. #Grateful https://t.co/HOXvENc0co
.@JenLongdon takes on DC. Congress doesn’t stand a chance! So proud of her leadership. I know her testimony before @WaysMeansCmte today will be impactful. https://t.co/t7f70nqxZa

Voters in Tempe (91%) and Phoenix (85%) both passed dark money bans in city elections. Congress first bill this session #HR1 banned dark money in federal elections (it awaits senate action). Voters in AZ will vote overwhelmingly in 2020 to Outlaw Dirty Money in state elections. https://t.co/wPp6Qf7x7p

Phoenix neighborhoods across the entire city strongly supported ongoing investment in light rail. I’m not surprised the people of City Council District 6 who I represented for many years and I now represent in Congress overwhelmingly supported @No105No106. https://t.co/nsZvlA7yFY
@irfan_batur A big win in Phoenix!!! How are you doing?
Yes there will be playoff basketball in Phoenix. Congrats to our @PhoenixMercury. With their win tonight they make the playoffs for the 7th straight year. #lovesummerhoops https://t.co/gysuhunADZ
This ain’t a small story. People support smart investments in public transportation. It’s one way to build a stronger city and country. https://t.co/lWqWtm7tnL

The @No105No106 won by an overwhelming 2-1 margin. It sends a clear unmistakeable message: People want infrastructure investment. I’ll take our message to Washington. It’s time to work together to pass a strong infrastructure bill. https://t.co/9VbPKdlovV
Thanks also for the strong leadership of @No105No106 campaign chairs: Councilwomen Laura Pastor and Debra Stark. #talent https://t.co/ArJoV1H5Q4

A great night for Phoenix and our region. Congrats @MayorGallego and the entire @No105No106 team. The people of Phoenix have spoken (again): transportation infrastructure investments make our city stronger. https://t.co/ODzmCSQHCe

The anniversary of Sen. John McCain‘s passing reminds us of the hole that remains in the Senate and our nation. Here in Arizona we must continue to build on his legacy. One way is by completing his passion project—restoring and activating the Rio Salado. https://t.co/j85l1YW3rI

Congrats Monica Villalobos (@AZHCCMonica) on being selected as the new CEO of AZ Hispanic Chamber. Your career has always been about helping others to thrive. You leadership will be critical to help grow Hispanic entrepreneurial success in our state. #Felicidades

Happy 80th Birthday to a great one .... my dad Fred. He’s still cracking bad jokes coaching youth basketball and eternally optimistic this is the championship year for @AZCardinals. https://t.co/K13CZypQuT

Two mass shootings in less than 24 hours...251 mass shootings in 216 days. Too many loved ones lost forever. Our hearts ache and our anger builds. The Senate must act now on the House-passed gun safety bills. For El Paso for Dayton for the families of victims. #EnoughIsEnough

Ballots arrive in Phoenix mailboxes any day now. I’m voting NO on both Proposition 105 and 106. @No105No106 is the best way to keep Phoenix moving on its positive trajectory.    https://t.co/XQsw9bh6cl

Phoenix residents: Today is the LAST day to register to vote in August's special election. Register online TODAY 7/29 by midnight. https://t.co/lkOHGLDLmy Voters have two important decisions about the future of light rail and pensions. Early Voting Starts 7/31 Election Day 8/27
Well deserved national recognition for our local civil rights legend @DanielROrtegaJr. #Felicidades https://t.co/W0NOV3aJ8w

Today I’m in Seattle with @VoteNewDems for conversations surrounding the Future of Work. I visited @Starbucks headquarters and met with Robert Lamb a leader in the innovative partnership with @asu to increase college attainment for Starbuck’s employees. https://t.co/vlAjP3BUSv

Save it or Shave it? State Rep. @JenLongdon is raising $$ for under resourced schools central Phoenix. If she meets her goal she’s shaving her head. That’s commitment to our students! I donated today. Will you help her out?  https://t.co/JycJllh82M
Face app! https://t.co/jPQ6TjwSQf https://t.co/9T4MNUnvek

Congrats to Ellie Perez (@EllePerezPerez) on her new job as political director for @ArizonaEA. She’ll bring her smarts energy and passion to advocate for Arizona teachers just like she did at Phoenix City Hall and my congressional campaign.  She’s a talent! #DREAMersDoingGood https://t.co/WZCtsF2Z7i
Congratulations @USWNT for an inspirational 2-0 win in the World Cup final. Best in the World. #USA #PayEmEqual https://t.co/5brnl2SzcT
Happy #IndependenceDay2019 . Another fun and patriotic Arcadia 4th of July Parade. https://t.co/AiiJmYFvUH

243 years ago brave patriots declared our independence from tyranny. July 4 celebrates freedom the world’s oldest democracy and our work to create a more perfect union. I can't imagine how those patriots would view a tank parade and partisan circus in its honor.

The maintenance workers who power our cities perform difficult dangerous labor—often without enough recognition. Our community mourns last night’s loss and our prayers are with these employees’ families. https://t.co/iJtNbuq1mp
Congratulations @MayorGiles on receiving the Chairman’s Award from the Latino Leaders Network. Your commitment to our community makes #Mesa and our region stronger.
@jontalton @valleymetro Yep. My son and I were heading home after the @PhoenixMercury game.
Violet had a blast as Jr. Captain for the @PhoenixMercury tonight.  She even met her favorite player and #GOAT @DianaTaurasi. https://t.co/XXG8vbTPlS
@kaitlynbrimley Hi Kaitlyn a member of my team will get in touch with you shortly. Can you DM your email address or best contact to get in touch?
Bipartisan #CongressionalBaseballGame about to start. @RepAndyBiggsAZ @ASU https://t.co/619oLWbjxb

Happy Father’s Day to our basketball coaching...Boy Scout Troop leading...city bus taking... church choir singing...always chop busting...keeping us humble...Dad Fred. Simply the best. #FatherDay2019 https://t.co/fA1y9p7SZD
Kill it today Mayor. https://t.co/rF3frsp7FK https://t.co/ZWuTPeLkHE

Happy 175th @ymca. I started at @ChrisTownYMCA at age 4 in YGuides program. Learned to play hoops at outdoor courts there. In college I tutored kids @YMCA_Milwaukee. As a parent I’ve coached my kids in Junior Suns/Mercury league.  The Y has always been a strong part of my life. https://t.co/VaflPreQjh

June 6 1944 D-Day marked the beginning of the end of WWII. The U.S. and our allies stormed the beaches of Normandy to liberate Western Europe from Nazi control. Those brave soldiers redefined heroism—and their sacrifice changed the course of history. #DDay75thAnniversary https://t.co/KrBY3SzmFb

30 years ago peaceful student protesters asking for democratic reforms such as freedom of speech and press were brutally killed in Tiananmen Square. While their stories are censored in their home country we honor them today and refuse to let their heroic actions be erased.

You deserve the support. Tempe is fortunate to have you on the city council and your collaborative leadership style is what our community needs. #FourMoreYears https://t.co/1jfiuDS1eZ https://t.co/WDgv0YQro9

A powerful mural dedicated to Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Children located in the alley behind The Churchill in #dtphx. Today I met the amazing artist Lucinda Hinojos (aka La Morena) to discuss her art and activism. #MMIW #StreetArt https://t.co/TAlLSrbYh7

Our Committee just passed the Dream Act and sent a message to our DREAMers: You are welcome here. I’m proud of @HouseJudiciary for taking this step to strengthen our immigration system. When we finally put our DREAMers on the path to citizenship our communities will benefit.

Congrats to Mesa @MayorGiles and the @CITYOFMESA team on today’s Gilbert Road Light Rail extension opening. Our Light rail system brings people and communities closer together. A fantastic finish to #InfrastructureWeek. https://t.co/cypgenDUMm

Inspiring Whitney M. Young Jr. dinner in support of Greater Phoenix Urban League. For decades our Urban League has been leading on affordable housing early childhood education and workforce development. https://t.co/6EHvUGnfdi
When civil rights advance our country grows stronger. #BendsTowardJustice https://t.co/V10dIiWcZG

I trust women their families and doctors regarding decisions about their own bodies—period. Those decisions should never be criminalized. Our fight to protect women’s reproductive rights didn’t start this week in Alabama and it won’t end there. We can’t back down.

Wishing you a wonderful Mother’s Day. I am especially grateful for Nicole and Carol my mother-in-law. I couldn’t do what I do in Washington and our community without them. They’re amazing moms and Nanas respectively. #momsrule https://t.co/2BE3nu2gMG

Celebrating #SmallBusinessWeek and getting my afternoon caffeine fix with an amazing young entrepreneur @llisondevane founder of @teaspressa in Arcadia. #AZ09 is fortunate to have a strong startup ecosystem. https://t.co/QsNGupDOLi

I advocate for good jobs in #AZ09 and throughout our region. With @GPEC leaders in Washington a great chance to talk infrastructure immigration reform and trade- all critical issues for our local economy. #GPECinDC https://t.co/H53HYtzx93
#Ramadan is the most important month in the Muslim calendar. The period of spiritual dedication and personal growth begins today at sunset. To all my Muslim friends and neighbors Ramadan Mubarak.

Celebrating entrepreneurship at the AZ Hispanic Chamber Black and White Ball. The success of our minority owned businesses and the success of the AZ economy are one in the same. #AZHCCBALL https://t.co/9RgymT4Qq1

#HolocaustRemembranceDay reminds all of us to hold strong our commitment to fight hatred bigotry and antisemitism. We honor the six million Jewish people and millions of others who were murdered during the Holocaust by standing up against injustice. #YomHaShoah https://t.co/tz1cxuI7qp

Jerry was an Arizona rock star. The rest of the country got a glimpse of her spirit during the 2016 election when she served as our state's honorary chair at the DNC. She reminded each of us to never take our civic duties for granted. We'll miss you Jerry. https://t.co/JEmOdXuuc9

Thoughtful humorous and occasionally hard hitting speech by historian Ron Chernow at White House Correspondents Dinner. The press aren’t the enemy they’re essential. #WHCD2019 #NerdProm https://t.co/htgxnfFwV5

Poway joins the growing list of communities forever scarred by gun violence. The shooting at a Chabad synagogue happened on this last day of Passover and six months to the day after the synagogue shooting in Pittsburgh. Anti-semitism has no place in this country.
While in the “520” today had to stop for the amazing carne seca tacos at El Charro. #Tucson #Mydietstartstomorrow https://t.co/bNnWhsok0L
A beautiful Sunday in Arizona! I hope you your family and friends are having a joyous and blessed Easter. https://t.co/ZUcxW5hyVe

The horrific attacks on Easter worshippers in Sri Lanka are heartbreaking. It fills me with sadness that an act of such hatred and violence took the lives of so many on the holiest of days. We have work to do so that every person wherever they live may worship in peace.
A meaningful Passover Seder at Temple Chai celebrating freedom and liberation. Beautiful company and good conversation. https://t.co/KfA4TipR9q
Happy birthday to one of the good people...@JenLongdon. https://t.co/cKm7glzHMB
Wishing peace and happiness to all those gathering this evening for Seder feasts. Happy Passover and Chag Sameach!

At the Lambda Legal Arizona reception with Violet where we celebrate legal victories for the LGBTQ community—victories that lift our entire community. Thankful for their work to make Arizona a more equal welcoming and just place. https://t.co/MuS7OUrroZ

Arizona’s drought plan is a great bipartisan victory. Proud of our entire delegation especially our dean @RepRaulGrijalva in the House and @SenMcSallyAZ in the Senate for doing what’s right for our future. https://t.co/M06CC9fQlT

The President’s desire to incite violence against a member of Congress is disgusting cowardly and beneath the dignity of the office he holds. He should be ashamed but he is not. We should be surprised but we are not. America is better than this.

A big kudos to the LGBTQ advocacy groups whose federal lawsuit forced the state legislature into action and to state lawmakers for doing the right thing. LGBTQ students should never be shamed or denied access to medically-accurate health education. https://t.co/LRKd2is6P8
Just hanging out with @repjohnlewis. Pretty good day. #livinglegend https://t.co/ffGI7xXQmR
I’m inspired by Heather’s success. @CircletheCityAZ works miracles in our city. https://t.co/wulQON8yb6
A perfect day and a large crowd for the #PhoenixPride parade 🌈. In Congress I’m sponsoring the #EqualityAct.  It’s long past time to implement this critical civil rights law. https://t.co/ZHvUvYUIiC
An inspiring night @emilyslist #WeAreEMILY gala. Great seeing a strong and impactful freshman colleague @katieporteroc. #ElectMoreWomen https://t.co/y8664aO34C

Since it started in 2013 @azgives has helped raise more than $13.4 million for Arizona nonprofits. Tuesday is the day! Pay it forward by supporting your favorite organization or find a new cause at https://t.co/6QhLDbMD8V. #AZGivesDay

I spent an inspiring Sunday morning where I needed to be: at Pilgrim Rest Baptist Church celebrating the installation of new Pastor Terry Mackey. Our community welcomes Pastor Mackey to Phoenix and appreciates the leadership of this essential church. https://t.co/ggZXvepQvd

Today we celebrate the birth and legacy of Cesar Chavez the American farm worker civil rights activist and leader of the labor movement. His cause lives on—we continue to find strength and learn from his fight for livable wages and safe working conditions.
Our hometown @SunDevilWBB play tonight in the Sweet 16 against top seeded Miss. State. Sending good luck to @ASUCoachCharli and the team. #fork’em #SurviveAndAdvance

Without strong leadership from @stephenroelewis and other Native American tribal leaders there would be no Drought Contigency Plan. Securing our water future in Arizona depends on partnerships. https://t.co/9Bs4xvoV5s
Just voted YES on Paycheck Fairness Act. It’s great for women families and a stronger American economy. Final vote total 242-187. A good day to serve in Congress.
Congrats to @changinghands named best bookstore in Arizona. A great place for reading good beer thoughtful conversation and community. https://t.co/blLh0HFDap
This is great news for Phx. Integrity + work ethic + motivator. Strong choice. https://t.co/gfPDTmhvSd
Once again @JenLongdon shines. She’s a leader at the local state and national level. A good article in @Forbes on her advocacy. https://t.co/5RZUEnf1hd

Rooting today for @SunDevilWBB in the first round of NCAA tournament. @ASUCoachCharli has led our team to 6 straight tourney appearances... a significant accomplishment. #GoDevils. https://t.co/WBtqWw1AUE
A fitting inauguration today for our new mayor @KateWGallego. Thoughtful forward looking collaborative and creative. I’m excited for our future.   #PhxMayor

I see you @GCU_MBB. Good luck to Coach @DanMajerle and the team in tonight’s WAC Championship game against @NMStateMBB. Can’t wait to see  @GCUHavocs in the Big Dance.

I stand with the people of New Zealand and Muslims across the world after the horrific murder of 49 people in the terrorist #ChristchurchMosqueAttack. America must help lead the fight against terror anywhere it occurs.
Madam Speaker. Violet takes over the House! https://t.co/9IvTTApjXG

Congrats @KateWGallego. With your election win the people of Phoenix get a leader with unrivaled work ethic intelligence and tenacity.  Our city’s positive future looks even brighter.

Karl Eller was a remarkable businessman and generous philanthropist. His leadership helped bring us the Suns and Cardinals. He supported the next generation of entrepreneurs by helping found his namesake @EllerCollege at the UofA. He will be missed but his legacy in AZ lives on.

On your retirement day thank you @SKrafftFox10 for 34 years of keeping the people of Phoenix well informed. Godspeed to you on your next endeavor.

On this day in 1870 the 15th Amendment was ratified granting African American men the right to vote. However it has also taken the 19th Amendment and women’s suffrage the Voting Rights Act and the soon-to-be-passed #HR1 to better fulfill its promise. #BlackHistoryMonth

It’s time to take action against gun violence. On Wed the House Judiciary Committee holds the 1st hearing on gun violence prevention in a decade. Thurs we will vote yes on HR8- Universal Background Checks. We will honor the work of @GabbyGiffords @lucymcbath and so many others.

This is a great bipartisan victory for Arizona and a recognition that climate change is already taking a real toll. So many in our state worked to get this done and I’ll work to make sure Congress does its part and authorizes these landmark agreements. https://t.co/Lxbb9VoRHO

The Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act became law 10 years ago today but there is still work to do. I’m proud to continue the fight for equal pay as a co-sponsor of the #PaycheckFairness Act which will be reintroduced tomorrow. It’s time to get this done and close the wage gap.

First public hearing of House Judiciary Commitee concerns HR1 (I’m a cosponsor). The bill helps restore confidence in our democracy through banning dark money restoring Voting Rights Act strengthing lobbyist disclosure requires nonpartisan redistricting and much more. https://t.co/1w9wIWR9an
